messages.title: If you really believe in our NHS, you have to vote Labour.
messages.content: Local values, local candidate, local issues.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Vote to save St Peter's Hospital and the NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Save St Peter's Hospital, bring 20,000 nurses and 8,000 more GPs.
Tackle 'cost of living' crisis, increase minimum wage and end exploitative zero hour contracts.
Labour will fill the 25% funding gap for flood defences and avoid flooding again.

issues.education: Labour plans to reform vocational education, ensure it will be in quality apprenticeships at university level by 2025, backed by a new gold standard technical education creating opportunities for young people.
issues.health: Save St Peter's Hospital, bring in 20,000 nurses and 8,000 more GPs, tackle the cost of living crisis.
issues.socialWelfare: Tackle the 'cost of living' crisis, rise of foodbanks, end unfair benefit changes like the Bedroom Tax.

leaflet.personalStatement: Hi, I'm Arran Neathey, Labour's candidate to be your next MP. I was very much the local candidate - I was born in St. Peter's hospital Chertsey, went to school in Weybridge and have always lived locally. I know the local issues that matter and will properly represent your views.

endorsements.endorsement: Parliament needs some fresh faces. Arran is a local young man with commitment and ideas. We're confident Arran will make a great representative for us and are assured he's fighting for the best deal for Runnymede and Weybridge.
Unlike UKIP with Arran Neathey we know what to expect and can count on their support for our jobs and local families.

images.caption: Image of Arran Neathey with his constituents.
